page.title: 10RELIGION.St.George'S Church.
page.content: Wrotham church is the second church to be built on the site.The first church was built in the 10th century.The present building dates from the 13th century and is approximately 700 years old.This church was named after the patron saint of England.The bells were installed over 200 years ago and cost over Â£300 which was a lot of money in those days.The brass eagle was installed in 1879.On the front of the pulpit is an angel which represents an 18 year old girl who was murdered on the hills in Wrotham. Wrotham has a population of about 2000 people but the size of the congregation is only just over 50 at the Sunday morning service.They hold _about 12 weddings a year at the most and 35 christenings.
